function: Allow users to submit new questions via a form.
static_description: A modal or inline form with two text inputs labeled 'Title' and 'Content', and a 'Submit Question' button. Background is beige (#F5F5DC) with saddle brown (#8B4513) borders and buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Submit Question' sends the form data to the /api/questions endpoint and closes the form upon success.
Pressing Enter in the title field focuses the content field; pressing Enter in the content field submits the form.

function: Display a paginated list of submitted questions with titles and excerpts.
static_description: A vertically stacked list of cards. Each card shows the question title in bold, followed by a truncated excerpt of the content. Cards have beige background and saddle brown borders.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a question card navigates to the detailed question view page using the question ID.
Scrolling to the bottom loads more questions dynamically if pagination is implemented.

resource_dependency.questionDetailDataSchema: Table 'questions': id (UUID), title (TEXT), content (TEXT), created_at (TIMESTAMP); Table 'answers': id (UUID), question_id (UUID), content (TEXT), vote_count (INTEGER), created_at (TIMESTAMP)

function: Show the full content of a selected question along with its associated answers.
static_description: Two sections: one displaying the full question title and content, and another listing all related answers. Both sections use beige background and saddle brown accents for headers and dividers.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking an answer's upvote/downvote button updates the vote count immediately without refreshing the page.

function: Provide a form for submitting answers to a specific question.
static_description: A textarea labeled 'Your Answer' and a 'Post Your Answer' button below it. Appears beneath the list of existing answers on the question detail page. Styled with beige background and saddle brown border.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Post Your Answer' submits the answer to the current question via POST /api/questions/{id}/answers and appends it to the list.

function: Enable users to rate answers through upvoting or downvoting.
static_description: Each answer displays two clickable icons – an upward arrow for upvote and a downward arrow for downvote – aligned to the left of the answer content. Icons are colored saddle brown.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking either icon sends a request to /api/answers/{id}/vote with the vote type ('up' or 'down') and updates the displayed vote count instantly.

resource_dependency.apiResponseIncludes: vote_count returned with each answer object

function: Display the net vote score next to each answer.
static_description: A numeric value shown adjacent to the voting controls for each answer, indicating the total number of upvotes minus downvotes. Text color matches saddle brown.

function: Store all questions and answers persistently in a PostgreSQL database.
static_description: No visible UI element; this defines backend storage requirements only.

function: Expose RESTful API endpoints for managing questions and answers.
static_description: No visible UI element; specifies backend HTTP interfaces.

function: Provide an API endpoint for recording user votes on answers.
static_description: No visible UI element; defines backend route for handling vote submissions.

function: Apply consistent styling across the application with beige background and saddle brown accents.
static_description: Entire site uses beige (#F5F5DC) as the main background color, while interactive elements and borders utilize saddle brown (#8B4513).

function: Ensure the layout adapts seamlessly to different screen sizes including mobile devices.
static_description: All pages adjust their layouts responsively. Question cards stack vertically on small screens, and navigation menus collapse into hamburger menus when needed.

function: Allow seamless navigation between the question list and individual question detail views.
static_description: Top navigation bar includes links to 'Home' (/questions) and optionally breadcrumbs showing path to current question detail page.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Home' returns to the question list. Clicking a breadcrumb link navigates back to that level.

resource_dependency.websocketOrPollingMechanism: Optional WebSocket connection or periodic polling strategy
resource_dependency.frontendStateManagement: Redux or React Context for updating vote counts client-side

function: Update answer ratings live without requiring a full page reload.
static_description: No additional visual elements; behavior managed entirely through JavaScript and state updates.

interaction_and_states.description: After clicking a vote button, the vote count updates immediately in the DOM without reloading the entire page.

resource_dependency.globalQuestionFormTrigger: Floating '+' button or fixed header form trigger

function: Make the question submission form accessible from any page.
static_description: A floating action button shaped like a plus sign positioned at the bottom right corner on every page. Tapping opens the question submission form.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the floating '+' button reveals the question submission form as a modal overlay.

resource_dependency.connectionPoolSetup: pg library configuration for Node.js backend

function: Establish secure and reliable database connectivity using predefined environment variables.
static_description: No visible UI component; this describes how the backend service connects to PostgreSQL.
